channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-1905] No enum constant 'TRUE' for AccessControl
item.description:
FRom the web console
http://localhost:9990/console/App.html#server-overview
I clicked on JVM and got a dialg popping up saying:
"Authorisation Required

You don't have the permissions to access these resources:"

////////// from terminal: ////////////////////

$ wildfly/bin/standalone.sh
=========================================================================

JBoss Bootstrap Environment

JBOSS_HOME: /usr/local/java/wildfly

JAVA: java

JAVA_OPTS: -server -XX:+UseCompressedOops -Xms2g -Xmx2g -XX:MaxPermSize=1g -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Djboss.modules.system.pkgs=org.jboss.byteman -Djava.awt.headless=true

=========================================================================

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This is still happening, even with the latest nightly: #646.

In fact, this problem occurs when I click on anything within 'Platform' or 'Subsystems'.

Is there a work-around?

This seems such a fundamental error, that I'm surprised that it has not been fixed yet - perhaps I'm missing something obvious?
This is no longer a problem in the latest nightly #647.
Fixed by upgrading the console, which was temporarily out of sync with the server-side code.
